content: Got stuck on a puzzle that wouldn't react to my touch. Deleted the game!
Very indepth, not frustratingly difficult or extremely easy. It's a sit on a sunny day and let your mind go off on this adventure. Loved it and i only got past the initial stage.
Too short
Great story line, great graphics and the puzzles are a mixture of tricky to fiendish. Brilliant

When playing The Room I never had to watch videos on how to progress, it was intuitive. I had to watch YouTube videos constantly with this series to figure out what I was supposed to do, which ruined all the fun. I would not purchase again.
Amazing graphics and the puzzles really get you thinking. I thoroughly enjoyed this game from start to finish.
It's a fun addictive game that makes you think and pay attention to detail
Awesome game!!!! Well worth ever penny of the 6 dollar cost
Great game and very challenging at certain points. Wish there were more like this one.
Thumbs up
Awesome game! Thumbs up for the makers!!!

I am out in the courtyard and the lever wont work. I even watched the walk through to see if I had missed something, I did not. I restarted the chapter and the lever still wont work. What a waste of money if I am unable to play. I was enjoying it.
replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for the review. If you have any technical difficulties, please get in touch with us via davinci@bluebraingames.com. Thanks!

content: Best challenge of the mind ever!!!
Controls are a little laggy else very good

Very well constructed puzzles, quite demanding at times. Sometimes it is quite difficult to understand the particular objective without using the hint mechanism. Also the medieval lighting can be quite annoying even when the torches are lit. Overall an enveloping experience.
Well done sequencial descovery game
Great fun working out how to move forward and with a sense of trepidation and excitement.
It was a good game really enjoyed it

99% perfect! I play on a big 10 inch tablet and the graphics are gorgeous. I loved the leveled hints, not too much revealed at once but there if you get stuck. This is the standard which all puzzle games should be judged by. Only 2 things I would change... When working on a puzzle, I often ended up moving the view instead of manipulating the puzzle. Also, the clicking letters puzzle has got to go! I still don't know what I did right and almost gave up the game, perhaps an explicit hint?

It's not The Room, but still an excellent effort, especially compared to some of the other examples on tablets. Well made hint system, reasonable justifiction for why there's all these puzzle about, a sense of urgency, all good.
Great puzzle game
Great game!

I like the graphics and the storyline is intriguing. Only three stars, though. The controls and the camera are so frustrating. I spent so much time tapping and sliding my finger around the screen, only to turn on the hints and find that I was looking in the right place but the object just wasn't reacting. Or that there was an area I could investigate but the camera didn't move there when I tapped before. Difficulty of puzzles is one thing, bad controls are another. Hope the sequel works better.
Beautiful graphics and a great brain workout. Really enjoyed playing this game.
Controls glitched and i ended up not being able to pass a level where i have to trace a symbol. Oh yeah and no refund...

Controls are poor. Feels like a rip off Rooms which is so much better. Poor lighting and difficult to find items. You have to click on an object so many times from different angles to get it to respond.
Just awesome

I can't believe I was unaware of this series, I have been missing out. The puzzles make you think constantly and the story is superb. I cannot wait to continue. Thanks to the developers of this game, very well done.

Overall a great mobile gaming experience. The controls can feel a bit clunky at times but it isn't so bad that it ruins the game. The puzzles are challenging but not too hard that you get annoyed. Graphics are good. Very similar to The Room series of games.

This game is realistic, innovative, and a true thriller mystery. The graphics on this game are beyond exceptional and I really get immersed into it. Love it!!! Its also not one of those where its to hard to figure put or where the clues are not enough, its perfect.
Not Just Another "The Room" Ripoff
It's a decent polished puzzle game. Deserves the money and the stars to continue producing content.
Just WOW!!!

Not as good as the room. Some puzzles are exceedingly finicky making it very difficult and frustrating to move on. Controls are lacking. Need to press exactly in the right area to actuate things and sometimes it doesn't register your touch even though you are pressing the correct area.

This is a beautifully created game with a story line and loads of puzzles. Do not be put off by the cost as it is great value. There are no adds or additional payments unlike other so called free games.
Excellent game, great graphic, fun puzzles... Could have been longer though

Very much like the Room series, which may be either irritating or a compliment to the dev's. But I say that with respect. I love the flow, the graphics, the puzzles and the hint system which doesn't give it totally away. Update. Chapter 7, for me, is totally confusing and extremely difficult and frustrating. Looking for cheats. Update. Feel stupid. Chapter 7 too hard. Couldn't get out. Uninstall. Dont know if I should do the second one or get a refund.

A very good Myst / puzzle / escape style game. I did run into a few problems on mobile from the controls and visuals. I will also say that there were a few puzzles that were impossible without hints due to these issues. However most of the game was very enjoyable and I will be playing the sequal soon.
Very entertaining.
Very challenging, great graphics!!
I played the second one first but this was just as good

The Room & this game are both awe inspiring & amazing in the puzzle genre. Both developers could be rivals. The attention detail is ridiculous! There's nothing else like it on the market. I hope they set precedence for other developers in the escape game genre.

Wonderful, with niveau, complexe puzzles and riddles, buy it, it's worth it, braintraining, awesome graphic and desings with details where you just WOW and an exiting story, thank you for making this kind of games I LOVE IT, well doneüëç

If it wasn't for the hints, I never would have seen half the stuff I needed, like scratches indicating what to do. The second problem is the controls are awful. Many instances of things not doing what I'm trying to get it to do, grabbing the wrong thing, or in some instances moving to different areas.
I enjoyed the puzzles. Atmospheric and entertaining. But NOT impressed with the ending!
I love the puzzles and the graphics??!! AMAZING!! Please make more! The Achievements room was an awesome touch!! Bravo!!!
Very interesting game, but the control is abit difficult, take some time to adjust.
Just finished the game and loved it. Can't wait to play the second game.
Loved it!!!

Fun and challenging. The end was a little disappointing.
Very good
i like this a lot

Challenging and fun I really like this game
Great gameplay... great puzzles... loved the attention to detail and the depth in each room... looking forward to the next one!

The controls are quite wonky, its hard to get ahold of and move certain things because the controls think I'm just trying to look around so instead of moving a mechanism it will move the entire screen like im looking, which is quit aggravating. I did end up playing through to the end because, I paid for it, and I hoped it would get better. Over all its a fun game but quite a few areas get very frustrating because of the controls.
Great game! Fun and challenging.
Love It!!!!!!!
Decent game would recommend to those who enjoy escape rooms kinda thing. It's not as expansive as some games iv played but it's pretty decent :)
Excellent graphics and game. I enjoyed this game and look forward to the next one. The authors should be commended for such a great job of creating this.
I love the graphics and challenges. I'not sure if the game is to dark or if my android resolution is off

Exciting puzzle game.. Nice graphics & animation. The game tests your logical & aptitude skills. All in All a very exciting mind sharpening puzzle game that takes you through the laboratory of the great Leonardo Da Vinci..
Loved it

Challenging and enjoyable, 5 stars.

Pretty much the exact same game as the The Room series. Puzzles were much more challenging to solve (you can still do it without using hints) than the Room but the game mechanics are not quite as good. Sometimes you have to actuate levers or swtiches on an object while the object is free to spin, so it is difficult to isolate the part you want to move. Purchase the game for $1.99 and very much enjoyed it, but I would pay the full price for it too. Well worth it if you like puzzle games.
A solid, fun, and engaging game. Well done!
Fun and entertaining.

cool game thank you xxx

This is definitely in my top three best games that I have installed, and that's an achievement as I have downloaded half of the app store, this puzzles and bamboozles the brain every corner you turn. Definitely worth the money and is worthwhile & multiple achievements to earn if you are keen enough with a sharp eye. 100% a five star game!!! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê I was even lucky enough to get a discount on the game for 1 pound 89!

Satisfying mystery game.

I really enjoyed this game and certainly got my money's worth out of it. I declined the 5th star only because so many scenes were so dark that I felt the player didn't have a fair chance of finding some of the more obscure clues. Still, a good value overall.

The gameplay and story are not as good as other games, in my opinion. I only unlocked 3 out of 6 Achievements, and I may not go back to find the other 3. *EDIT 1/1/2021, starting a new game because I'm a completionist.

Actually, I'd rate it 4.5, but well worth buying. The graphics are superb and it gives oodles of gameplay. My criticisms would be the controls are awkward, navigation is a b√Øtƒáh and it's way too dark.

puzzles are challenging but not too hard.

Is quite awsome. Control is a bit flawed at times and gameplay is a bit too easy, but the graphic really made up for it! Going to buy chapter 2 on my ipad instead of my phone so hopefully controls will be a bit smoother. So much respect for the artists and devs - those complex mechanism are so dang sexy.

Fantastic gameplay. Its up there with the best is genre Room and Rusty Lake both of which I love. The play and controls are smooth and accurate and the puzzles progressively get more difficult. Hints are very good as well.
Excellent! Very rewarding upon completing.

It is very like the room, but I personally did not enjoy it as much. The plot is worse than none in particular. All I had in mind is that I was one step away from Da Vinci and was disappointed every time when seeing room after rooms. Is me the only person consider it stupid to let your follower solve the hardest problems and let your enemies in? The lens can only be used at specific locations which is counter-intuitive. Why you can't see a thing from 3 steps away but OK if you just get closer?
Loved this game unfortunately there were too many glitches mostly with the oculus

Heavily "inspired by" (ahem!) the Room series this is an excellent challenging and varied puzzle game. The movement is a bit clunky at times and, like the Room(s), is too dark and interactions can be fiddly on a small screen. The puzzles are fairly varied and creative and are often quite difficult as, even once you work out what to do, it can be a challenge to then do it. It was longer than I expected, so decent value for money. Will definitely be trying part 2.
Good experience
Beautiful game. Complex puzzles with gorgeous artwork and a pretty engaging storyline. 5 out of 5 stars!
By far best escape / puzzle solving game i have found. I see they have a second game that I will happily pay for.

Is a bit tricky in some parts. The hints are leveled which i like. No commercails just a timer that you wait on for the hint to become available. Since I puchased was glad I didnt have to suffer through adds to get hints. Took me a little under 5 hrs on the first casual play through, tried to just use hints after feeling stuck. Found all the "achievements" fairly easy. Game is dark, so need the brightness turned up.
Well i remember how good the room game is. This is just that

Literally such a good game. So well made, and very creative. If you are scared of a challenge, then come prepared for fear, cause this game will wrap you in and not let you go until you have figured out every puzzle.
Excellent puzzle solving game. No distracting pop ups or requirements to buy things to advance levels. Highly satisfying.
Love this game!
Love it

I hardly ever purchase games, but this one captivated me from the title to the credits. The graphics were superb and puzzles a great challenge. I look forward to more like this! It was well worth every dime!!!!

I wasn't taken in at first, but a little perseverance and it turned out to be a really decent game. Sometimes it can be a bit frustrating when you don't hit exactly the right spot to turn something or place an object but overall well worth the money
The game is incredible... but I was expecting more about the end.
Not too easy, not too hard, interesting puzzles, light on story but at least it isn't banal drivel. Great music and graphics.

Great. Worth the full price. I appreciate that you cannot skip the puzzles. Will buy any game from these creators.
Beautiful. Challenging. Neverending!

What an underwhelming and frustrating experience. The tap windows are terribly small, the puzzles are a stretch, I can barely see any details because it's so dark and finding the point to click to pull or turn something is insanely difficult. The premise was fun but not enough to overcome the problems. This a a terrible attempt at a "cover" of The Room games.
It was great..hard but each puzzle was easy to understand after some thinking..trial and error..

Awesome graphics,been a fan of these escape games for many years now. This is definitely one of my favorites ü•∞. I got lucky and got it on sale,but would've paid the full price,and still may have to on the second one!
Great game, puzzles are amazing, not to easy or hard, hints needed every once in a while.
This puzzle game is great. Can't stop playing. Graphics are excellent.

The game is so interesting because it forces me to sit back, think, and observe. My critical thinking skills are being tested and I love it! Something that most things don't nowadays. The gameplay is intriguing, and the story plot gets the blood pumping for me. The graphics are just gorgeous and the hints are amazing in a way that it helps without telling the next step outright. All in all its a lovely game that I don't regret spending money on.
Fantastic game worth penny
Excellent and clever game. I can only recommend it if you want to challenge your brain.
Really enjoying the challenges and the machines. It's a beautiful designed game

Fun but a bit dark. Could use a little tweeking of the controls. Looking forward to part 2.
Mind boggling and mysterious puzzle game.. Really admirable feat by the Dev team.

It's an interesting premise, but the game mechanics are poor. For example, you need a special device to see certain things. But when you use it, those things are often not seen. Often those special things aren't seen until certain clue times have passed and you have to use the clues to see the items, not before. It may work fine on iOS or a computer, but it needs serious attention for Android. It's clearly been ported over without nearly adequate prep work. The Room series is better.
awesome game
Exquisite game. I love the challenging and well thought out puzzles.
Addictive

Great game with puzzles at every turn. Yes some do make you scratch your head but once figured out you wonder why you didn't get it in the first place. Wish it was a little longer as just a few hours gameplay for ¬£4:99

Challenging, but definitely doable. Each puzzle and scenario creates an interesting dynamic. Every puzzle is different, so a different thought pattern or idea is needed. Would I play it again? Hell, yeah.
Good... End should be better..

I really like the effort the dev put into this game and I would definitely get the sequel.

While the graphics and puzzles are intriguing, the controls and gamma make it hard to play. Found myself constantly referencing hints only to find I was doing the right thing but I just had to try 10 more times until I actually flipped a lever or something instead of rotate my camera. Being so dark of a game, sometimes I have to wait until it's night and turn off all the lights just so I can see the game. Add gamma control and refine the contextual controls and this would get five stars easily.

Awesome but frustrating. Graphics, music and puzzles are really good. Trying to swipe and insert or move things correctly is another story - sometimes taking many attempts. This drags out gameplay. Finding some items is near impossible and I wouldn't have been able to without using hints. The rooms are dark and after finding out where things are I can guarantee I would NEVER have found them if it weren't for hints and googling. Overall it was a fun game though.

Fun, but often frustrating experience. Like being in a Renaissance escape room - the puzzles are fun to solve, but the click-and-hunt parts to find clues can be pretty tiresome - especially when the movement is so limited. It kept me going until the end, though, and it was really fun to watch the various machines come to life. Leonardo was the original steampunk.

Interesting puzzles but clunky to the point I may have to stop playing. Try to turn a key or crank or move anything and the room spins. Very difficult to manipulate the environment and gets very frustrating. Flipping a switch is harder than solving the puzzle half the time.
Not worth the time, certainly not worth the money. It's basically a way less polished version of The Room series, minus the fun.

A very well thought out and constructed game. Challenging in places with very well hidden elements. I got stuck a few times with no clue what I was supposed to be doing, but not enough that I had to use a guide, just the hints was enough to see me through. Controls can be a bit fiddly at times.
Definitely a thinker. Great game to pass time
Very enjoyable, if you enjoy these kinds of games. It's a must.
Extreme glitches. Couldn't enjoy the gameplay
Amazing game! Full of really intricate puzzles, plus the graphics are amazing and the whole game is interactive. If you liked the "room" franchise, you'll absolutely love this!
Really engaging, lots of logical puzzles to keep your brain working.

I played other games of this type, this has a lot more pixel hunting, some moon logic, and lots of busy-work puzzles, I literally had to fit the cube into the square hole and the ball into the round hole as a "puzzle". The hints are annoying too. The first one is incredibly obvious, "you should open this". The following hints are either obtuse or spoile the puzzle. The lenses are used so rarely that you forget to use them when you need to. The controls are bad, I have to struggle with them.
Simply awesome
Love the game. Whoever made this is genius. Waiting for part 2 to be on saleüòÅ

I like what I've seen of this game so far. My only complaint, and it is personal choice, is the inverted controls; they are opposite to the way you want to look from the first person perspective... But only when you're zoomed out (when zoomed in the control works the way you would expect: left is left, up is up, etc). It would be good to have an alternative controls option. Other than that, I love the graphics and the ambient noses and music. Overall a solid, entertaining effort.
Mechanics are atrocious. Oculus works half the time and touch screen mechanics are horrible. Stuck in a level due to the mechanics and cannot progress. Otherwise, game is great, hence the 2 star.
One of the best games Ive ever played. Challenging but not difficult. Will definitely play every sequel game.
I love these kind of games. They are interesting and very addictive. I've already beat the first one and I'm working on The house of Da Vinci 2.
Really fun and enjoyable game, worth the price
the game is just too damn glitchy trying to solve the puzzles is near impossible.
Awesome game!
Absolutely amazing, 10/10!!

Controls are a bit buggy, you can click on something 100 times and get nowhere, then a hint tells you to click on it and suddenly it works. Finished the game in 5hrs20mins. Bit short, I've played free escape games that last longer. I only paid ¬£0.51, so not too big of a deal but I would never pay the full price. Order of puzzles wasn't clear (ever), without the hint system you'd get totally lost. Graphics are good, story is good, controls need work.

Very well designed! I was genuinely surprised and confused by all the puzzles. One small thing I'd like to point out is that sometimes you have to struggle tapping on things. Not sure if it's an issue with my phone or it's the game that sometimes it's not responsive. All things considered I really loved and enjoyed this game.
Fun to play, nice graphic and helpful tips

Easily the finest Android game I've run across. Sophisticated without imposing frustrating complexity. Hints, when resorted to, help in the best way without giving away too much. Exceptionally well done, with high quality and classy, immersive graphics with wonderful sound and storyline.

Really fun game seems like the game "the room" which I also love

Very enjoyable game. Challenging puzzles. Terrific graphics. A hint system that's there when you need it with just enough to get you moving again without taking away the challenge or making you slide through a walkthrough video trying to locate where you are at in it. And my favorite ingredient - relevance! There's a reason the puzzles are what/where they are - each is part of the story, not just a random obstacle. A beautifully crafted work of interactive art. Yes! More of this! Huzzah!
Such a fun game with really interactive story and amazing graphic! However i feel that the levels could be added to extend the story until I meet the Leonardo Da Vinci.

Control of camer and game play is worst. You will hate it from the beginning till the end . Gameplay and details are worth a try .
Loved the game. If you liked The Room or any kind of escape room, you'll like this one.
There is a glitch only a few minutes in where I can't zoom in on the bottom of the pedestal to complete a puzzle. Unable to progress further because of this. Wasted my money.

I'd give more stars if the controls weren't so utterly frustrating to the point I cannot enjoy the game. The angling and limited control is infuriating and needs fine-tuned. Only thing that keeps me from uninstalling for the 2nd time is that I paid for this. The puzzles lack direction, logic and flow. Otherwise, graphics are alright and would be a seemingly enjoyable game with a somewhat cheesy storyline. Rooms series devs did such an outstanding job. I prefer Room series over this by far.

AVOIDworst experience ever the game is clunky and now the strategy part on the globe is impossible each tower decreases instead of increasing when i take a lower country so I CANNOT FINISH THE GAME..plus the screen lags and now the hint is obscuring the game and wont disapear luckily i only paid 50p otherwise i would demand a refund....0/10 the room games are 1000times better I HATE SLOVAKIA

This game is beautifully designed, but as some have mentioned, not all the puzzles are necessarily intuitive, leaving you to try and solve them by trial & error. Then, another issue is that any given puzzle does not necessarily lead you to the next. In other words, you may find yourself picking up pieces/clues to the various puzzles outside of the required order. So, you may find yourself solving puzzles as you get further along into the chapter, then you come across a puzzle that you are certain you are performing correctly, but it just won't work. As it turns out, there was some piece that you were expected to already have in your inventory that you somehow missed, and there is just no telling where that piece may be, and the hints are not always so clear. For example, the hint may call for you to go to a specific location or object, calling that object or location by a name that you may not be able to identify. So, you go to one of the online tutorials to help you find your way, only to realize you would have NEVER found that object on your own. I‚Äôve read some reviews where some players have complained that not all the mechanisms work; they do, but can be very specific in regard to what they need, where things can be found, and what exactly to do with these things once you have them. I would say that this is probably what makes the game so challenging, if not impossible, without good references. You will need a lot of patience to get through this game, even while using all the hints. Still, I think it is a particularly good game, but the sequel is much more intuitive and does a better job of making sure any given puzzle leads to the next in a more coherent manner, and is easier to understand where you are supposed to go and what you are supposed to do.

Cheap rip-off of the room games. Controls are really glitchy. You have to tap a lot because you could do the same thing 100 times and it will only work if you touch the screen just right. Story line so far wasn't to bad. Really disappointed!

content: It's a blatant ripoff of The Room series, but the puzzles become infuriating due to the clunky and obtuse game mechanics in later levels. With The Room series I would try to avoid using hints, but in this game you'll use all of the hints and still be tapping and swiping everything until you discover something moveable. It has high production value, but struggles to provide unique puzzles that aren't stolen from The Room series.

Other stuff feels very pixel-hunty to find the correct place to tap to zoom in so you can interact with a scene.

It often felt like groping around in the dark, which isn't much fun (if you're playing a puzzle game.)

But great value, long play time if you don't rely on hints all the time.

At 1st glance it's like The Room, which is why I bought this. My issue is it removes player autonomy from the game and the complexity of tasks & explorability isn't there. The Room is such a success b/c is the tasks are rarely linear, multiple areas to explore & find artifacts and you're working on several tasks at once. In HDaV, you find & use an item immediately. The puzzles are great, but there's no dynamics. It's all one note. Pick it up, use it here. You're forced along a set path...Meh.

Lost in this game was an understatement. I got so immersed in this once I started playing. Perhaps that's why I think it is too short. It's very dark, so I found it difficult to play in direct sunlight. Full price for a game I can complete in a weekend seems a little steep, but great value when found at reduced price. Need more games like this.
Great experience awesome puzzles but the sensitivity needs to fixed its hard to alter some items in the inventory but otherwise great game

It's decent and somewhat fun, but there are too many moments where the puzzle won't zoom in to something small or a function doesn't work quite right. Definitely lacking in its biggest competitor, The Room series.

How have they not been sued? It's a complete rip off of The Room. Same fonts, and eyeglass peice, it's almost identical. This game is a fraud and I hope they end up in court. I bought this game thinking it was a Fireproof game, no some company in Slovakia. Buy the Room Please, everyone report this game as the fraud that it is.

The game is great but it's filled with bugs. Many times the have doesn't respond to the actions needed to go further. Either the inventory won't fit in the right place where it's supposed to, or the actions needed to move items will not happen no matter how much you try! Currently stuck at chapter 6 because how much ever I try, I am unable to move the gems on the locker table in those rotating wheels. Every time I try to slide the gem, the wheel rotates.. it's frustrating!!!

I agree with the complaints about the controls, puzzles, etc, that are in the comments here. Nevertheless the art and the cleverness of the displays and machines of da Vinci rendered here is overwhelming. I definitely will buy the follow-up. So much represents da Vinci's work in an accurately historical way. I'm now reading Walter Isaacson's recent biography of da Vinci and see more tie-ins that I had missed.
Just wow! Very well done!

Having played all of "The Room" games to date("Old Sins"), one can tell that this game borrows heavily from that series...but falls short in its execution. The good: The graphics, the story, and backdrop are very good. The bad: Painfully delicate controls makes it hard to navigate or solve some puzzles, and some puzzles are so absolutely devious and layered you wonder how you could have figured them out at all. (At least hints are unlimited.) Overall, good, but not a 'must play'. 3/5

As good as (if not better than) "The Room" series. The graphics are stunning, gameplay is gripping and exciting. My only issue, and it's a small one, is with the touch controls. It's almost as if you're playing on a PC and your mouse sensitivity is too high. Also requires you to be meticulously accurate when placing, rotating, or sliding different puzzle pieces. Like I said, this is a minute problem and should not stop you from buying this brilliantly executed game.
The best game
The scenery is way too dark. This game is impossible to play, except maybe in a completely dark room.
Love the graphics, lots of great puzzles and mechanical challenges.
Nice graphics like most of the puzzle games but the ending was very anti climactic. Puzzles were ok and there were some interesting machines

Wanted to like this. Graphics were good, and the DaVinci backdrop seemed interesting, but i found the controls EXTREMELY clumsy, and the game progression often unclear unless i used hints. Too much time wasted on bad zooms and adjusting found objects. A well-designed, difficult puzzle is enjoyable, but a sloppily-designed-and-therefore-difficult puzzle is upsetting. I played through all four The Room games without any of the phone-smashing frustration this game caused in the first room alone.
Not quite as good as the room series, but still a worthwhile purchase. Controls are sometimes a bit frustrating.
What a game!!!

Pretty cool

Really enjoying it so far

Worse experience than any of Room games. Several puzzles with a 90's adventure game logic with the most straightforward/sane solution often not often being the correct one but on the other hand 80+% of puzzles being incredibly easy almost like in a walking simulator. I've never needed guide in Room games, but I've used ingame help in here several times. It's hard for a game developer to find the right balance of difficulty and Blue Brain Games didn't find it.
Ultimate game one of best game

The easiest way to describe this game is a less enjoyable version of The Room series. It seems everything good about this game comes with a caveat. The places where the user can move are not intuitive and can hinder your chances of solving a puzzle. The lens mechanics work fine, but the first one is badly implemented (you can't always see when it works) and the second is used as a call and response device - barely a puzzle. I wish I could like this game, but it's issues mean that I can't.

While I want to review this game well it just comes out painfully average at the end of the day. The graphics are great, which makes it a shame the controls and puzzle elements are sub par. The game is plagued with control issues and puzzles that are solved by moving a wonky component that you more than likely wouldn't have seen if the hint system didn't the highlight it for you. I want this to succeed but it doesn't come close to the standard set by others e.g. The room.

It was a very fun puzzle game. If you liked the room games you will like this game. The only negatives from my experience is the touch controls. There were times where you had to be very precise as to where or what you wanted to move. For example on item had a tiny switch that had to be moved and your touch on it had to be very precise if not it did not move. This made game progression a little difficult as it made you think there was nothing to the item even though there was.
Well done!!! Great story, exciting and challenging puzzles. If there is an improvement required, it would be the control during the puzzles. It requires too much precision while moving the objects.

Loved this game! It was very immersive compared to other games of its type. The scenes were beautifully rendered and the puzzles were easy enough to be fun but challenging enough not to be boring. It was enjoyable seeing how the DaVinci devices would reveal each new clue/item. The hint feature was perfect in that the hints got progressively more revealing if you needed more help. I'm sad that this game is over and can't wait to see what Blue Brain will have to offer in the future!

The House of Da Vinci isn't a bad game. It takes a lot from The Room series and tries to improve it. But there are a lot of problems. The most noticeable problem is with the controls. Game doesn't give a damn about what are you trying to look at or where exactly you want to move elements of the puzzle. Which is absolutely critical for a puzzle game for touch screens. One more problem is that some of the puzzles don't make any sense (IMHO). It's playable and somewhat enjoyable though.

content: The House of Da Vinci is a mediocre Room clone. It tries really hard to get the same feel but doesn't quite get there. Some of the elements you have to interact with are very much not clear or are so small and finicky that you fumble just to get the right movement. The hint system is useless half the time, either giving you such obvious information eg "I need to use this thing I just got somewhere" followed by "I know I saw somewhere to put that thing around here". Or are unclear
replyContent: Don't think about the game as a rip-off, rather than a tribute. We are big fans of The Room games and we've met the creators. Yes, it's quite similar, but only with the best intentions. We are all fans of 3D puzzles here after all. Please drop us a line to davinci@bluebraingames.com if you have anything to add. Thanks for playing!

As a backer I was told to just buy the app and they'd pay me back later.. A terribly run Kickstarter results with exactly what most wanted, It's a complete rip off of Fireproof Games' The Room series. The story is about chasing Leonardo Da Vinci through his estate. Solving puzzles and mechanical wonders so you can proceed. It's worth 5 bucks but not all the BS I had to deal with in the kickstarter. So good devs with terrible PR and management.

To say that it's inspired by The Room would be an understatement.. Gameplay is virtually identical (not that that's a bad thing at all), and while it just falls short of matching the quality as well this is a great game to play and well thought out. I love some of the detail here - e.g. Any panel that opens includes the latches that were previously keeping it closed. This may be a minor thing, but it's a great attention to detail.  Very much hoping that there will be a sequel.

The puzzles themselves are stupidly simple and easy. To compensate for this, interacting with anything in the game is futzy and obtuse and pointlessly fidgety. Difficulty is derived not from challenging your mind, but from challenging your patience as you tap on everything waiting for some element to arbitrarily respond. Do yourself a favor and stick to The Room. Edit: Thank you for the gently condescending reply, but no - it's your design mechanics that fell short for me, not my understanding.

12 HOURS of gameplay over several days, anticipating every moment I could pick up where I left off.  2nd best game I've ever played (THE ROOM series at numero uno). Loved the little hidden pockets, buttons, doors, doodads that proliferate each level/location. The Occuli lenses worked flawlessly, the hints were perfectly arranged & the "Aha!" moments never ceased. I had some puzzler areas when the controls were wonky & there were a few rooms that had some tedious back & forth and/or repetitive strategies. The game would dawdle off track for awhile before picking back up. But it always DID find its groove again. Excellent game! Greatly appreciated!

The majority of the puzzles were easy but some were literally mind boggling, no real consistant difficulty, last but not least the hints system is a pain, I had to turn it off as it was annoying me! Visually nice game though and I did appreciate the work!

replyContent: Hi Jason. Thanks for the review! The game contains 7 levels and the average gameplay is about 8 hours. For many players, it takes several days or even weeks to complete ‚Äì it depends on how many hints you're using. We'd of course like to make the game much longer, but in this genre, it's not easy to do (from the budget/resources point of view).

Actually, this was a pretty hard game. But the hint system was very good, and didn't make me feel like I was cheating. I normally don't need many hints in these sorts of games, but I needed rather quite a few for this one. The graphics were very good. I was only slightly disappointed in the ending, but I presume that the ending was the way it was to make room for a sequel. The game length is pretty good; at the end the game itself told me I took 11:30 hours to complete it, which is a nice feature for the game. I don't know what the "achievements" are for, though. I've heard they are for replayability, but I probably will not reply the game.  One thing I will note, however, that many times during the game, when you had to manipulate a control on the screen (dial, lever, slider, etc.), the screen itself would move around instead of the control, which got a bit frustrating at times.

A blatant rip off of The Room series by Fireproof, down to how you see hidden parts of puzzles and the font on the scrolls. What makes it intollerable is the lack of controls over the puzzles (often trying to manipulate the puzzle pieces simply rotates the camera perspective) and the game is entirely too dark. There is no reason I should have to jack up my screen brightness to the max setting to be able to see the game. The company needs orignal ideas, as the game had potential.

Game won't keep the screen on; annoying! And why do the most menial tasks require manipulation? I have to push open doors open? Literally turn keys inserted in locks? Gratuitous busy work.

It's hard to say why this didn't click, but other games in this genre (I'm not going to be rude enough to rep another game by name in this review, but it's pretty clear what this game is trying to imitate) did, for me. I love these kinds of games, but this one is really difficult to follow. Nothing is designed legibly enough to tell where things fit, it's never clear whether something is meant to be interactable or not, and clues often just don't appear, so you just run out the clock for hints.

The best thing I can say about the game is that clearly a lot of work has gone into the graphics. It's a pleasure to look at, and I appreciate the artistry invested into the environments. Sadly, I found the game's puzzles to at best be childish, or at worst require blind fumbling to find a solution. One good example of the latter is the catapult in the workshop which requires you lob small flaming projectiles into waiting braziers. At one point, the game can't continue until a brazier is lit, but the brazier is in a darkened (and un-explorable) portion of the workshop, and no visual indications are given as to where the flaming projectile must be sent, so this requires the player to fire at random until success is achieved. Another frustrating part of the game I encountered several times is that you're unable to progress in a level without the using clues visible only through one of the two secret lenses given to you at the opening of the game, but these clues aren't visible until other steps have been finished. In theory, this is a great way to make the game more, ahem, "puzzling," but in practice is massively frustrating because it requires relentless and repetitive inspection of the game environment that borders on pixel hunting.
replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for your review - please, if you have any problems with particular puzzle, don't hesitate to contact us via davinci@bluebraingames.com. In most cases, it's not a bug or a glitch, rather than misunderstanding of the puzzle mechanism. Have a great day!

content: I've played all of the Myst and Room games, and was looking forward to this one because it looks very similar, but found it really frustrating. Sometimes you pinch to zoom OR double tap to zoom, but these actions don't always work. Sometimes a thing that looks interactive isn't, or "isn't yet" interactive, but it's hard to tell because the double tap/pinch doesn't always work. Some of the puzzles seem really arbitrary, and felt more like guessing than solving. At least the game looks nice.

content: very fluid movement, interesting puzzles

Good game overall! Great job on the visual language. I really enjoyed it, and look forward to future games! One critique, from a UX perspective: The mapping for "x" (in item & oculi views) is inconsistent. "x" exits item view, but not oculi views (it brings up a pause/options menu). Clicking item thumbnails doesn't exit item view, so it's cognitive friction remembering which is which. I also (unsuccessfully) kept hitting "x" to try dismiss hints after I used them. :(

content: Its okay if you're looking to fill the void until the next The Room game comes out. Some puzzles have some originality, but many puzzles are just plain tedious and simply take trial and error... My biggest complaint by far, is terrible viewing angles/controls... Especially the earlier chapters... The way viewing angles are locked, sometimes you're forced to zoom in too far, or not far enough. And then often if you want to view the object just next to the one in focus, you often have to zoom back out 2-4 levels... Instead of just tapping on the new object. The other issue with viewing angles being restricted, is that often you aren't allowed to focus on an object until you actually need to use it... So you end up believing an object can't be interacted with, only to find out after a lengthy search or (extremely vague) hint, that there is something unusual about that object you previously weren't allowed to look at (the carved wooden pillar in the tomb is a good example) In summary: some tedious/busy work puzzles, controls, viewing angles/depths, and restricted viewing ability are all absolutely horrible... But the rest of the game besides those things is very good, and i hope the team fixes those problems (and gets a little more comfortable creatively) for their next game!

content: This game wants to be The Room so bad it hurts (Right down to the title font!) but it's not quite up to the challenge of being The Room. Controls are sometimes finicky. Puzzles are repetitive and often uninteresting. Rooms are sometimes a bit too dark to see clues. The hardest part is often finding where the next puzzle bit is rather than solving anything. They finally throw in a pretty ambitious puzzle at the very end, but it was too easy to brute force the solutions once I had the gist of how it worked. Really an excellent demonstration of how much polish went into The Room to get it as good as it is.  Edit to reply to dev: Oh! Didn't mean to imply I thought it was a rip-off. It's clear y'all were very inspired by them. My issue is that you were inspired to *be* them, and can't quite pull it off. I'm looking forward to what y'all do in the future.
replyContent: Don't think about the game as a rip-off, rather than a tribute. We are big fans of The Room games and we've met the creators. Yes, it's quite similar, but only with the best intentions. We are all fans of 3D puzzles here after all. Please drop us a line to davinci@bluebraingames.com if you have anything to add. Thanks for playing!

If you like the Room games then you will like this. Brilliant graphics, range of puzzles from simple to hard and good story line. Wish they had more games like this.
I decided to play it again. And I believe I jump to conclusion it's a fun game I do recommend people to play it. So keep up the good. I do hope y'all make a sequel to his game.

Absolutely brilliant, even beats The Room for me.

I love games like these. And much like "The Room" & "Forever Lost" this didn't fail to delivery great puzzles and story. If u liked either "The Room" or "Forever Lost" and their sequels I highly recommend you give this challanging game a go too, u won't be disappointed. 10 out of 10.

Awesome puzzle game in vein of the similar popular puzzle series on the store. Itll make you think. Only con is some solutions were hard to find but love the history and story as well. Hope there is a sequel to explain more.
Great game!
Loved the puzzles and the graphics were beautiful.
Beautiful insanity

This game is great! So many puzzles to solve and no hidden objects to find. Graphics were so realistic. Music was wonderful. Puzzles were very challenging but hints gave just enough of a clue when you get stuck to get you back going again. Lots of playtime. I'll be looking for more of their games!
Excellent game play, rich graphics.

Very high caliber puzzle/escape game. I wish there were more like it. If you liked The Room games you'll like this.
Love it
Really enjoying this game

Lovely to look at but at times a pig to play. Obviously inspired by the Room series, a lot of work, care & attention to detail has gone into this game, but like all puzzle games when you're stuck it becomes frustrating & boring. Some puzzles are easy while others are obscure, frustrating or just plain dull. (Eg. The door lock in the last area, easy but tedious). The room with the suit of armour was overly convoluted. A backwards & forwards exercise into pointlessness. Yes, it's clever at times but lacked a real sense of purpose & with suspect controls, it was often too tricksy for it's own good, with one too many silly eye pieces in the mix. If there's a sequel, it needs an overhaul.

content: You def need to make a 2nd one

Great storyline. Fun and enthralling. Clever puzzles that challenge your processing abilities. Keen to see more from this developer! Only small problem were the controls not being as smooth and easy as possible. Quite often tapping on something wouldn't register and also I'd tap one area of the room but it'd take me far past it. But this is an easy fix that can be developed for the next instalment. Love the game still.
Excellent graphics and interesting puzzles, some familiar, some new. I liked seeing the references to da Vinci's works.
Wonderful!

Although a blatant homage/copy/rip-off of the fabulous "Room" series of games, that not necessarily a bad thing. The gameplay is very similar, read almost identical, and even the tone of the graphics. However, this wasn't The Room and despite being very enjoyable it does fall short: The clues are invariably too late and suggest something you've already done and the puzzles swing from the incredible simple to the extremely obtuse and random. The end was also very odd and was in dire need of a ' to be continued' notice. That said it was very enjoyable and anyone waiting for the next installment of the Room series, this is a fine stop-gap.
Fantastic game with lots of helpful hints
Such a challenge but in the best way possible. Intricate puzzles and cool features.

I really wanted to love this game but the puzzles were at times very easy and others impossible. I like a challenge but impossible is not fun and I almost stopped playing the game in chapter seven when I reached the Astrolable puzzle. Once you set the moons correctly the rest was purely by chance. On the bright side I loved the graphics and the length of the game was great!

I like this more than Safe Cracker, because of the story telling.

The room style. And it leaves me wanting more.

replyContent: Hi Carlo. The game contains 7 levels and the average gameplay is about 8 hours. For many players, it takes several days or even weeks to complete ‚Äì it depends on how many hints you're using. Amazing graphics, well researched, great transitions. All in all a fantastic m8md game.

As a fan of The Room Series, the Rusty Lake / Cube Escape games and puzzle games in general, I was pleasantly surprised to come across The House of da Vinci. The historical link added any extra depth and the puzzles themselves were intricate and well thought out. The earlier mechanisms in particular were beautifully engineered and rendered with living detail down to every hinge and cog. I very much enjoyed my time with Leonardo and would welcome forget instalments. A great game!
The game was good and the puzzles where ok but it was far to short I finished the whole game in less then 7hrs and I'm left wanting more.......
Absolutely Fantabulous Game! Fully recommend to any fellow puzzler. Unique puzzles. Great game play. Loved it, Blue Brain Games. I hope there will be more!!!

Cool graphics. Great puzzles. Challenging.

This one seemed gorgeous and thematically appealing. But it is not. It's just a succession of room search and device manipulation that feels overly convoluted and repetitive. The puzzle are simplistic and the narrative non-existent. As for the graphical design, the screenshots looks gorgeous. But while playing, you spend most of the time zoomed in on objects and everything feels flat with pasted low-def textures. All in all, a huge disappointment!

Good puzzles and utilusing the environment well.
Love this game.The graphics are beautiful and puzzles not to hard.The hints are helpful but not too easy

I stumbled upon this game accidentally while searching for a new entertainment source. Although it is shorter than I would like, it is an amazing game. The details and puzzles are fun and the visuals and intrigue is great, while being intertwined with the history of Da Vinci. These game creators really need props. I thoroughly enjoyed this and hope for more of this game and more like it.
Good graphics sounds good great puzzles more please !!!

Absolutely beautifully crafted. A very challenging and addicting game. I was a bit bothered by the response to some of the objects that you must double tap. Rather tedious in some cases for the game to respond to touch. That is the ONLY negative in this game. In every way, just a fantastic mobile game.

Some interesting puzzles and imaginative settings let down by awkward controls. Feeling much like a "the room" clone, the is actually a little bit more story here. On the other hand the early puzzles are mainly poor and often take to long even after the solution had been find and the controls throughout are awkward to the point of occasionally being almost unusable. The puzzles do pick up in later rooms so patience is definitely rewarded. With a little more polish this could be a quality Interlude while we wait for the next Room.
Everything about this game is excellent. Top notch in all respects.
Some of the puzzles were a bit complicated to fathom out. I enjoyed the game but got annoyed when the puzzles kept moving camerawise and not just the pieces
Awesome!!! Surely they'll make more I hope!!! Worthy every penny!!
Fun and challenging.
Fantastic mobile puzzle game
I loved it
What an awesome game, addicted from the start, I'm gutted I've completed it, off to search for something as good.
I'd been looking for something like "The Room" and this hits the spot beautifully. Lovely game play, challenging puzzles (hint option available) and great graphics. Worth the money!

I absolutely LOVE this game. I loved "The Room" games 1, 2, and 3 and was trying to find something comparable to them. Not only is this game comparable, it's actually better than "The Room" games!!! A+ rating from this guy. You guys should be proud. You knocked it out of the park with this one!!!
Puzzles and mysteries and problem solving galore. Love it, graphics are dark but adjust your settings and you should be fine. Such a great game.

Gorgeous addition to the escape room genre. The puzzles are clear but complex, the graphics are gorgeous and the plot is interesting. replyContent: Hi there. If you use a third party cleaning app,  make sure to deselect this game when cleaning, otherwise you'll lose all of your progress. Also make sure that you have enough free space available for the game progress to be securely stored. If the problem persists, please get in touch with us via davinci@bluebraingames.com. Thanks!

replyContent: Hi Gage. Please, don't think about the game as a rip-off, rather than a tribute. We are big fans of The Room games and we've met the creators. Yes, it's quite similar, but only with the best intentions. We are all fans of 3D puzzles here after all. Please drop us a line to davinci@bluebraingames.com if you have anything to add. Thanks for playing!

replyContent: Hi there. The game contains 7 levels and the average gameplay is about 8 hours. For many players, it takes several days or even weeks to complete ‚Äì it depends on how many hints you're using. We'd of course like to make the game much longer, but in this genre, it's not quite possible to do (from the budget/resources point of view).

Fun puzzle game like The Room games. Basically identical. BUT for the love of god you need to patch the spectral eyeglass to actually work the first time you use it. It would often not trigger the spectral image and I'd end up just feeling stuck. It's a pretty important part of your game. Fix it and you get a 5.
replyContent: We believe you may have been using the oculi in a wrong way - you actually have two oculis on your glove. The first one - Oculi Infinitum - takes you through time and the second one - Oculi Tempus - reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down.

The extent to which this game is a rip-off of The Room series is unfortunate. If I were Fireproof Games, I'd feel mighty litigious. For those who have played The Room series, there's really nothing here that's better or innovative. I don't understand the reviewers who claim otherwise. Update: I appreciate the Dev's responsiveness, but ultimately, when we respect and admire the forerunners in our field, we owe it to them to attempt to compete in a more honorable way. Granted, this is a phone game and not a new car, so people can probably afford both. Still, I would like to have seen more innovation instead of such gratuitous "borrowing" of truly innovative ideas. It really plays like another Room game, but with slightly less masterful execution. But hey, if Fireproof is down with this then I'd add another star and root for your next effort.
replyContent: Hi Matt. Don't think about the game as a rip-off, rather than a tribute. We are big fans of The Room games and we've met the creators. Yes, it's quite similar, but only with the best intentions. We are all fans of 3D puzzles here after all. Please drop us a line to davinci@bluebraingames.com if you have anything to add. Thanks for playing!

content: I bought this because I really enjoyed all of The Room games, and I had heard that this was similar. Clearly a lot of work has been put into this game so I don't want to take away from that, but personally I did not enjoy it. I didn't find it visually appealing (too dark, very hard to see anything) and controls are very finicky (for example if you aim and are off by 0.5 of a degree you miss, and trying to manipulate items is unnecessarily difficult, sometimes I missed things not because I didn't try to interact with them but because apparently my touch was not quite "right"). Also really disliked having 2 different lenses - it makes game play unpleasant. Really had to force myself to finish this.

content: It's a fun game, took me a bit over 4 hours to complete. Good story line and familiar concept if you've played The Room games. Guessing isn't as fun as hunting for clues or putting "two and two" together, so that's the only reason I gave it 4 stars. Looking forward to the sequel!

Gorgeous graphics, visually inspired and an absolute delight to play 
especially after finishing The Room series. My biggest complaint is how the 
controls sometimes seem to get stuck. It's sometimes hard to infer where to 
go next in order to succeed and while Im pleased with how much that 
encourages looking upon a fascinating environment, I've gotten stuck and 
agitated before as a result. There's nothing wrong with challenging 
puzzles--just a problem of where to go next. The hint system is mostly 
helpful but it can be a little obtuse or obvious on the first hint. If I'm 
halfway to solving a puzzle I don't want to know that I have to look at the 
chest of drawers when I'm inside it and working on a sliding tile puzzle. 
That ending, guys. Please tell me you're planning on some followup or 
something more concrete because it leaves behind a feeling of clueless 
frustration and a sense that things never truly came to a head. Your human 
models are also really excellent and the movements are clean so I wouldn't 
exactly mind seeing more.

This is a wonderful game. I've thought for a long time (tech-wise) that 
there wouldn't be a game that comes close to the "The Room" series. But 
HoDaVinci comes as close as I've seen. In fact, I had to double-check to 
see if it came from the same developers. The graphics are beautifully 
stunning. The gameplay, as with The Room, is challenging but not 
ridiculously hard. Hints come along at apropos times. Controls are 
responsive and sensible. I normally won't pay for a game I know nothing 
about without a bit of a taste, especially one for $5. But I went for it 
and haven't regretted a penny spent. Go ahead, if you like these types of 
games, and go for it. A great game.

[Update] I have all of The Room games, and this one is visually and 
creative puzzles, it is surely visually stunning and fun to look at, but I 
had tos solve the puzzles by clicking and fiddling around until the game 
decided it wanted to solve itself, I constantly had to wait for hints to 
pop up, cause I didn't know what could be interacted with and what couldn 
not... I don't want to compare and it's not fair, but I figured out the 
solutions to some puzzles but the game wouldn't allow it, cause I was not 
touching the right pixel perfect. The Room games made it clear by allowing 
the player to know the general area where you can interact by just 
activating the lens, and it was and integral part of the story, here it's 
just a gimmick. It has so much potential but it's rather flat, I only 
finished it because I paid for it. Didn't even read the story cause I was 
annoyed most of the time. I'd give it a higher rating if it had some kind 
of voice acting, cause I sure didn't want to read anything after struggling 
with the controls, (NO, THEY'RE NOT INTUITIVE, as it states in the 
description.) A patch or an update could fix a lot of these issues, I know 
it's practically asking to remake the game, but maybe there's a way to 
tweek something at least. At least for future players. Cause I for one 
won't revisit this game, I learned about unlockables at end of the game, 
and I'm not sure if I want to go back to this one.

puzzles with most having a logical progression. Hints are progressive so

well. As others have said the control s can be a bit annoying, I prefer not 
to have to pinch to get out of a scene. I kept on going to the menu 
accidentally when I'd forget to pinch to get out of looking at an item and 
hit the cross instead. I still highly recommend playing this game.

(unlike The Room), a fiddly clumsy and sometimes buggy interface (unlike 
the Room) and puzzles that were often tedious and pedantic (unlike The 
Room... in one case you have to trace complex shapes, and if you let go the 
whole thing restarts). I quit the game because of a bug in that puzzle that 
wasn't detecting my touch on the screen properly, thus the shape couldn't 
be finished. A pity

Many reviews I read before buying mentioned The Room series, and it did not 
disappoint! This game is very well done. Beautiful graphics and excellent 
puzzles put this right up there with The Room. The only issue that I could 
mention is with the ability or inability to get to certain places in the 
scene. I was stuck at a few points, thinking I needed to do something else, 
when I just had to click the place I wanted to go/zoom in on, from 
somewhere else. These few places were a little less intuitive than the 
majority, but I eventually found my forward. Overall, this game provides a 
very beautiful experience with some of the most interesting, intricate and 
engaging puzzles that I have seen in a long time. Well done Blue Brain!

Loved it!! Would love to be able to buy more games like this... Excellent 
integration and examples of Da Vincis' inventions brings the game to life. 
It's not The Room and its not trying to be. The fact that the gameplay is 
intricate and exciting in its design is where the comparison can be made 
but it has its own story. It would be an interesting way to bring other 
historic characters to life. While teaching history in this form I doubt 
anyone could criticise or dislike the subject. It would be an excellent 
idea to transition into teaching aspects as long as the information stats 
are correct. Did i say i loved it?!!

Excellent graphics. Terrible game. No storyline, no logic to items or 
mission so most of the time you have no idea what you're supposed to do. 
Absolutely no way to complete this game without the use of hints. Half way 
through even hints didn't help and had to watch game play on YouTube. Bad 
experience. Will not be purchasing another game from them.

Beautiful graphics, great puzzles. Some of the puzzles are pretty tricky, 
but if you get stuck, the hints will give you clues. The solutions are 
sometimes very precise, so be patient and try different things. In some 
cases, it was hard to get my finger swipe to create the desired effect and 
it took awhile to get the movement/position just right. Also, after you 
open the oculi, you have to tap on the desired lens (which in itself is 
tricky), to see the fluorescent clue or the traceable shape. I didn't 
realize this at first until I watched part of a walkthrough video so I 
missed some clues in the first level.
Nice more update please

screen bigger than a 5 inch S7. Overall a good game, but just lacks a bit 
of the polish that The Room series has, also a bit on the pricey side,

Looks like a rip off from The Room, some mechanisms in puzzles are almost 
identical. However, I liked it very much anyway. Few puzzles were odd and 
more frustrating than challenging. Moving between screens is sometimes 
weird and feels like walking around. Some mechanisms in the inventory were 
hard to trigger on the phone as it tried to move them instead. Ending was 
disappointing so I hope to see second game.

If you have played The Room games, the this will be familiar territory. In 
fairness it's kind of a Room ripoff (similar graphics, controls, puzzles, 
etc.). That said, it really dstinguishes itself in terms of overall 
complexity and depth of the different levels. A few complaints I have are 
that some clues are too ambiguous, some hidden objects don't provide enough 
graphic visual evidence there is something there when you closely inspect a 
given item/area, some objects requiring an item be fitted to them don't 
allow you to zoom in close enough, so it can be difficult to inspect a 
specific fitting, and some controls don't respond as well as they should 
(like one of the pipe valves you have to manipulate on the boiler supply 
lines). I wish there were a few more levels, but overall I really liked the 
game and will definitely buy a sequel.

What an amazing game !! Good music, incredibly original and fun puzzles 
plus a good story and graphics.
Very long play time

While I enjoyed the game and loved the graphics I found it finished

This game is severely let down by how hard it is to interact with an 
object. So many times have I tried to pick something up/Rotate/Open 
something; not been able to and moved on... Only to realise later, after 
exhausting every other option and looking up a walkthrough, that it was 
possible.

content:
Wow! At first I thought this was just a knockoff of The Room trilogy, and 
while it was clearly inspired by those games, it is every bit their equal. 
(Do I blaspheme?) Which is quite honestly a shocking achievement. Those 
games are classics, but this game belongs right there with them. The 
puzzles are challenging but logical enough that you can work through them. 
The graphics are top notch. Every detail has been meticulously thought out. 
Is it the most original concept? No. But who cares! If you love The Room, 
you'll love this too. If you don't love The Room, well clearly you've never 
played it. Either way, you'll love this game. Edit: I've been finding 
myself craving a sequel. Blue Brain Games, can you tell me if anything is 
in the works?

This game is addictive. So many puzzles and a great story line. My only 
dislike is that the game is so dark that I have to turn my screen way up 
and I can't play it outside, because I can't see it

First of all: the game is great! If you only read the reviews for buying advices, you got mine.  The game seems heavily inspired by and is quite similar to the (just as great) "the room"-series. And yes, you do have those lenses. However, the house of da Vinci knows how to from from other's mistakes and delivered a wonderfully atmospheric game here.  The controls feel a bit unresponsive at times. Sometimes I tap on something and it doesn't work. Then I assume that thing isn't usable, walk around half an hour before using the (relatively well-made) help function only to learn that that was exactly what I was supposed to do. Then I retry and it miraculously works. But those things are minor and rare.  The graphics are average to good compared with other puzzle games at that price.  As for the story: take the story of the room only that you chase after da Vinci here. Not exactly creative but serves it's purpose.  Now what you will probably be most interested in: the puzzles. They are challenging, even if you are familiar with the genre and aren't too repetitive. Yes, you do have the common ones like "find the lever" or "move that square over the whole place with touching each square exactly once" but they are always embedded into a whole sequence of riddles in each room. That brings me to a minor thing I noticed that I didn't exactly like: In each room there is always exactly one order in which you have to solve the puzzles. I would have wished for a bit more freedom here, although I do understand that this would have made it nearly impossible for the creators to include the previously mentioned help function.  All in all I rate this game 4/5 BUT it can get 5/5 and here's how: release a 2nd part. The ending is so open that I cannot call this a 5/5 game if it just ends like that.
I think its a bit expensive for such a short game, at least put another 2-3 rooms in it.

when stuck if need be. Me and my mother played this together and I caught 
up to her very quickly and we helped solve the puzzles together and traded 
phones to solve puzzles for each other that the other was having difficulty 
with. But none of these puzzles are blatenly obvious or boring in any way. 
They become increasingly hard and I loved it. This was beautifully 
constructed and I can't wait for more. The controls can be a little buggy 
but most often it's quite alright.

content: This app breaks all the rules as far as my phone is concerned; the cache is being used for "permanent" game status, so routine cleaning of cache data as performed by Android cleaning apps wipes out the profile and any current game status. Additionally, the "hints" just give you the same information instead of giving you progressively better hints as other games do. No provision for "skipping" a particularly difficult puzzle. Inconsistent user interface; sometimes "pinching" exits a scene, sometimes you need to click the "X"; other times clicking the "X" takes you to a menu where you must select "Continue" or optionally, change options or Quit. The story line isn't particularly compelling or consistently moving forward, and the puzzles sometimes feel. like they are just there to be another puzzle, instead of progressing the storyline. Sorry, I just couldn't get into this game, between having to restart after my cleaner wiped out the profile, and trying to follow the obscure storyline.
replyContent: Hi Jim. Thank you for your review, we really appreciate it. replyContent: Hi Tom. Thanks for the review! Regarding the oculi - you actually have two oculis on your glove. The first one - Oculi Infinitum - takes you through time and the second one - Oculi Tempus - reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down.

Changing my review to 1-star after the buggy unplayable mess that is the workshop chapter. When I noticed earlier that the game had fiddly controls that didn't always work, I was ready to let it slide, but after seeing how bad it gets I'm uninstalling. The eyepiece feature is just flat out broken. I shouldn't need to toggle it 10 times and change my camera angle to get a puzzle to appear. It's ridiculous. Also, when your puzzle game is based on manipulating objects via touchscreen, you MUST have good touchscreen controls, and this game just doesn't. I wasted hours on puzzles that I *knew* how to solve but couldn't quite manage to get the game's controls to recognize that I had solved. The bottom line is that buggy controls ruin a game that I really wanted to be good.

content: Great game. Awesome details

This game is fantastic, especially for folks who enjoy puzzle games in the style of The Room and similar titles. The game is beautiful, it's not terribly hard to get a handle on, and overall the puzzles range decently from simple to "how the hell does this work?" (with the former usually overcome by looking everywhere and trying everything.  That said, I have two key criticisms. The first is brightness. The game is not very hard to control, but at times it's hard to know where you can go in a room, as the game is a bit darkly lit. I understand this is likely by design, but even with turning my screen brightness to maximum, I found myself not able to actually see all the places I could go/examine all that well at times, and wound up resorting to hints just to get an idea of where I was to go next.  The second issue I had was with the camera controls during puzzles. I played this on a Nexus 6, which has a massive screen, meaning it wasn't hard to see what was interactive in a puzzle. Yet because the camera doesn't lock on most puzzles, I found that at times I would go to move a piece, only to have the camera swing wildly when I missed the object's hit box (something I also found some issues with, they were hard to hit at times). It was incredibly frustrating to have to recentre the camera every few moments when this happened. While I've completed the game now, I hope this gets adjusted for new players, as I could see users with smaller screens getting very annoyed at this.  Overall, I will heartily recommend this game to my friends, though I'd also possibly recommend waiting to see if it ever goes on sale before picking it up. $6.99 CAD wasn't bad for what I got, but I'd have also liked perhaps one or two more chapters for that price. Here's to hoping for some bonus content at a later date, or a sequel, which I'd happily buy!

replyContent: Hi! You may have been using the oculi in a wrong way - you have two oculis on your glove. The first one takes you through time and the second one reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. Sometimes, you need to try both oculis to find out what's the deal with the puzzle. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down.

While it was a great puzzle game I feel that it wasn't quite on par with The Room games by Fireproof. For example, while the puzzles we're fun and very challenging there were several instances where I would find the solution (or a hidden door) and would attempt to solve or open said door and the game wouldn't allow it...after failing several times to solve or open the secret door I would end up moving on to a different part of the room thinking I was doing something wrong only to finally give up and use the "hint" button (I hate using hints on this kind of game... always feels like I'm cheating)...the hint would then point me back to where I was at before and have me try the same door or solution I tried before and after several attempts it would finally let me through. I never had this problem with the Fireproof games and as such it made the game a little frustrating. One specific example I can think up off the top of my head was (spoiler alert) the wooden puzzle box on the table...I played with that box for a solid 5 minutes before giving up and figuring it was just a box I would have to place somewhere before it would open...after wandering the room for a while I gave up  and used a "hint" which told me to take a closer look at the puzzle box I picked up...I again spent another 5 minutes on it before I finally got the box to open up. Anyway, it was a great game and I would definitely recommend it. Storyline was fun, puzzles were difficult but not impossible, great time killer and brain teaser but for sure could use some work. I rated all the Fireproof games 5/5 stars...this one gets a 4/5 because of what I would call "glitches".  *Edit* Read some of the reviews below and it seems I'm not the only one with problems...I liked how they worded it better than I did though as "the controls". The controls were frustrating and definitely made me want to say "screw it, I'm done" but the curiosity in me kept me going until the end.

replyContent: You may have been using the oculi in a wrong way - you actually have two oculis on your glove. The first one takes you through time and the second one reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. Sometimes, you need to try both oculis to find out what's the deal with the puzzle. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down.

content: I liked it. It was a challenge. I just wish it was a longer game üôÄüòø

Obviously a knock off of The Room series, but mostly a well executed one, and the type of graphics-rich puzzler that The Room pioneered is a genre that could use more entries, even if Fireproof has done a job that's impossible to beat. The game play with this one is a little less enjoyable and a lot more frustrating, for me at least; one of the puzzles giving me trouble had a reset button, thank goodness, but I wish others had. By the time I looked up a walkthrough on some of those I'd made such a mess of the puzzle that I had to start the chapter over just to get a blank slate to follow the walkthrough from. Many puzzles seemed to involve a lot more random luck than logic, and for many of them I still have no idea how I was meant to figure them out without a walkthrough video or what some of the clues or symbols were supposed to mean. Many of the controls were also really difficult... that pump with the sliding and rotating handle had me about ready to quit the game, I was so frustrated just with trying to make it move properly. Did manage to get to the end but never would have without the help of the Internet. Ending was a bit of an anticlimactic but obviously is just the setup of a sequel, so not a real disappointment for me. (Is it sad to say I was just glad I was done struggling with these puzzles? :D) I hope with the next game the developers will strike out on their own more without so much direct and pretty blatant copying from The Room; this is obviously a talented team, I hope they'll trust in that and infuse the next game with more of their own concepts and style. Either way, I'm sure by the time the next game comes out I'll have forgotten exactly how much this one frustrated me and be ready to go for round two. :D

At first I thought this game was just a rip off The Room, but apart from the obvious striking similarities, it also turned out to be quite different in many other ways, with more than just a few nods back to the legendary Myst series.  I actually think the overall quality of the game is much higher than The Room. It has characters, pretty convincing animation, more believable and logical mechanisms, more plot, better aesthetic structure (but see below), and the puzzles are more varied - and some of them I thought were quite ingenious. Also, the difficulty curve was more obvious, with the last few chapters beginning to feel more challenging! (in a nice way)  Yes the ending was a let down. May I give my advice to the developers: simply make the cutscene much longer! (and/or consider adding an epilogue room) You can end on a climax, or ramp down after a climax using e.g. the golden ratio. But - if there is an anticlimax, and you end then and there, it isn't a fulfilling aesthetic structure! It's really much more complicated than that, but that's just on simple terms to be getting on with. Anticlimaxes have epilogues. Source: I am a classical musician.

** Edit following completion of game: 1. There is NO way that I completed the game in the 2h30 that the game stated as I have been playing this on/off for about 10 days so I have no idea what that time is supposed to represent?! 2. The ending is NOT rubbish, just the set up for Part II which I shall buy as soon as it comes out!! ** Apart from the INCREDIBLY frustrating bug of the eye piece not working and having to activate/deactivate a dozen times before it works, this game is fantastic. The hints are awful and aimed (imho) at 8 year olds (no offence to any 8 yr olds) I can see that I need to work out a sequence, you don't need to tell me that! There could be more distinctive sound clues, eg the moon sequence could click when you have the (exactly) the right moon position but I suppose I am being picky. If you are a fan of Myst and/or Room (1,2,3) then you will love this. Worth the money. Thank you!
