This game shares the same gameplay of the Room.  Graphic is great but control is a bit of a mess and could be frustrated at time.  There were times when I wanted to move some levers but instead the camera was moved.  There were a few times the view was very limited that it was hard to tell if there was more to be done.  As for the puzzles, 80% was good and challenging.  The rest was either didn't make sense or had to be completed in trial and error.  The was a "moon phase" puzzle which I knew exactly what needed to be done; however since the game doesn't allow zoom in to the patterns, I didn't get all the spheres in the collect positions.  I was stuck for a long time not able to understand what I did wrong.  I still enjoy and finished the game.  I really like the use of da Vinci theme.  Oh and for the achievements, there is no way to tell if I have collected all of them.  I am the kind of person who would replay a game to collect all hidden treasures and achievements.  All in all, not a bad game but not as good as the Room.

Riding in on The Room's coat tails. Puzzles are direct lifts and not very engaging. Controls are clumsy. Plot is The Room 1 with name changes (follow handwritten notes from old man scientist through building while trying to find secret experiment before the baddies following you, while unlocking puzzles, then jump into a portal/gate) .  Feels flat and unexciting. Hints pop too quickly, finished in two sittings and felt like I'd achieved nothing. Looks blooming beautiful, don't get me wrong, if a bit dark.  Knicked 'lens' mechanic from The Room with rubbish attempt at justification, did like the time-lapse though, that was new.  Gutted, as I really wanted to enjoy this as much as I enjoyed Room 1-3. Unfortunately it's a really good looking book, with no new content, and the controls and plot are poor enough to hinder enjoyment.  The puzzles are less time manipulating the items, and too much running between rooms/platforms. The lovely animation quickly becomes a tedious "let's watch this unskippable slow-walk on rails another 40 times"  Also, a notebook or scratchpad option is required. Some puzzles require you to copy information from one location to a location that it's not visible from. People playing on their phones will not always have a separate pad of paper no more things on, just add one in game, or have automatic notes populate when the clues are revealed.  At a higher cost than The Room 1-3, get them first. This is a pale shadow, but shows promise for future games from BB if they build on what they have. Not bad at all, but the series they used as 'inspiration' is far superior, and cheaper.  I'll still get the sequel when it arrives, expecting good things.
A really good puzzle game. Every bit as fun and well crafted as The Room series. Worth every cent

The controls are why over sensitive thangs way to close often you go to move one object and instead you undo what you just did so it is a lot of repeating the moves that you did already so you end up doing it all two or three times when you actually got it right the first time I have a samsung galaxy 8+ and it can be very frustrating so I couldn't imagine what it would be for other phone's that could be smaller.

replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for the review! The game contains 7 levels and the average gameplay is about 8 hours. For many players, it takes several days or even weeks to complete ‚Äì it depends on how many hints you're using. We'd of course like to make the game much longer, but in this genre, it's not easy to do (from the budget/resources point of view).

replyContent: Hi Tony. Please, update the game, open the Achievement Room, tap on the "x" icon in the top right corner, choose "Main menu‚Äù, "New Game" or ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù. The game will reload step by step from the intro chapter to your last saved position. Enjoy the rest of the game!

Clearly inspired by The Room series- even giving you a lens device to read secret messages- House of Da Vinci is the rare imitator that manages to equal, even surpass it's inspiration. The plot is nothing to speak of, serving mainly as an excuse for a bunch of renaissance-steampunk mechanical puzzles, but those puzzles are creative and interesting, and just clever enough to be challenging instead of frustrating. Graphics are low poly, but compensate with skillful use of color and light, the end result being a beautiful game world that also runs much smoother than The Room 3. Derivative, maybe, but still a cracking good puzzle collection.
Love this game!!!

*Update* Lowered the review by one star. The controllers are just so annoying I'm losing interest in the game.   A game influenced by The Room series. Some things are so similar I hope they won't have any problems with Fireproof Games ;)  However Blue Brains added some very nice new ideas that makes it a top notch game. The only problem for me are the controls. You drag up, it wants to go right, you drag left it wants to go up or down and so on.   Overall a very nice game. Great job! Can't wait for what you have in store next!

This is actually better than The Room 3 in several ways - the puzzles are better - both more clever and more challenging; and there is not quite so much pointless running back & forth from room to room - if you need another item, you generally know it, and can either remember where you might get it, or you can figure it out (as opposed to the somewhat arbitrary requirements in The Room). I say challenging meaning the solutions take some hard thought, strategy and sequenced use of tools, but they ARE solvable with what you have been given (with a couple minor, frustrating exceptions I won't mention due to spoilers). When you have solved some of the more complex ones, you feel like you've actually accomplished something, as opposed to just checking off requirements that are internal to the game. The graphics are super and reflect a lot of effort and thought so I found them more interesting and in fact more beautiful than those in the Room series. I REALLY like the look back in time feature, I wish it was used even more. Just great. Give me more!
Awesome, very worth your time and a few dollars

Total mixture of amazement and annoyance. Stunning and clever game! But controls are irritating. No easy freedom of movement. I wanted to stroll around and find things but kept feeling horribly rooted to the spot stuck with pivoting. I wanted to kick the hints in! They kept stating the obvious rather than hint at the strategy I wanted to understand. Some puzzles were completed by random bewilderment and chance. I wanted to understand the process if I felt a need for a hint, not be told to try out a lever I was already brainy enough to try! But the negatives aside the game is a joy to behold! Fabulous graphics and puzzles that give you something to think about! More please! Plus great with no ads or annoying extra expense. BUY THIS GAME!

Top class puzzle adventure.  Yes, it was probably inspired by The Room but nothing wrong with that and it is in the same league without question. Graphics are smooth and beautifully rendered. Story line is excellent, the factual content about Leonardo is a bonus and nice touch.   Puzzles are plentiful, varied and with a good range of difficulty. This makes the game long enough to be easily worth the money. The only (slightly) negative comments I have are:  Some hints don't really help; they just state what is obvious about the puzzle not how to tackle it, Sometimes the controls are tricky to manipulate, e.g. you might want to move a handle horizontally but it has a big tendency to go vertically. But this is meant more as feedback for the developers - don't let it put you off trying the game.  Great job, looking forward to next release.

Fun, but controls are vauge and frustrating. Items need to be pointlessly-yet-specifically manipulated (keys turned, screws screwed, items facing just the right way before they'll join) and with a phone screen and fat fingers, I occasionally want to throw my phone down. It's especially frustrating when I know the solution to a puzzle, but I cannot manipulate the items in the proper way. It wouldn't be so bad if the controls were responsive, but they're not. Things don't always lock into place - swipe too hard, you overshoot; too soft, nothing happens. It's enough to make me want to stop playing, which would be a shame as it's a beautiful game with decent puzzles.  Come on, devs. This is a phone game, not an action game on a counsel.

Added a star after completing the game. Very similar to another game which is good but some of the steps to complete puzzles can turn into a backtrack and start clicking on anything you can zoom into. The puzzles tend to involve going back and forth between rooms with absolutely no insight as to where to go. When you give up and use hints (which you will) the hints leave you in a "and how the hell was I supposed to figure that out" feeling. There is a lot of trial and error with this one. Solutions are still satisfying but more than a few solved puzzles don't give you a feeling of accomplishment using hints after your left with nothing to go on. Don't get me wrong this is a VERY good game and well worth your time. I can't wait to see this series evolve I hope they add in just a bit more subtle direction as to where to go next.

Good looking, fun puzzles but man are the controls a pain in the butt! When trying to move pieces of a puzzle, you will constantly move the camera by accident instead of moving the puzzle piece (or move a piece when trying to reposition the camera angle). Most of the frustration in this game comes from the either over sensitive or under sensitive touch controls of the set pieces or camera. If you liked "The Room" 1,2,&3, you'll like this. The puzzles are as much fun, the story is almost as compelling, but the controls can be maddening.

One of the best puzzle games I've played on Android. It looks stunning and there are plenty of varied puzzles. Control of the various devices is not quite as good as The Room 3 - occasionally the camera moves instead of the mechanisms - but this is still an incredible game.

The graphics are great, but I found some of the puzzles very repetitive and frustrating, just moving shapes around endlessly trying to get them in the right places.  Also, control on a phone is difficult, as often the background moves as well as the actual bit you're trying to control.  I got as far as the sphere in Chapter 3, but just couldn't get the things the right way round.  I can't be doing with the rest of the game if it's as monotonous as this, so I'm reluctantly giving up.  What would be really great would be a skip button, so if you really get stuck on a puzzle, you can still move on.  The hints tell you what you need to do, but not how to do it.  Edit:- Thank you for your response.  I've finally managed to get past the cabinet in Chapter 3, and now appear to be out in a courtyard.  I may continue for a bit to see how things progress, but this game is as frustrating as it's enjoyable, and at the moment, there doesn't seem to really be any aim to the game.  As I previously said, a skip button would be welcomed.  Also, it would have been nice to have had a trial available before paying for the game.  Edit: 15/12/17 - I finally managed to complete the game, but only with the help of a YouTube walkthrough for some of the parts.  I have now given an extra star, simply for the graphics and the way that the game operates smoothly and with no lag.  The ending was a bit unrewarding after all that effort, but strangely, even though I hated the game as much as I liked it, I'm slightly disappointed that it's over, and would probably be tempted to torture myself with a sequel, but my points above still stand, with reference to a skip button and a trial version.

Definitely one of the best puzzle/adventure games on here! My ONLY gripe is the number of times I KNEW how a puzzle should be solved....to the point of knowing exactly how to move something only to try and try and try, but because of either incorrect zoom into a specific part of a puzzle or an object not responding to my touch gestures it made me assume I was barking up the wrong tree. When I then query the hint system I yell internally "I JUST TRIED THAT!!!" I'm fairly certain I could've beaten this game if only it were in real life and I could grab/touch things the way I physically wanted to. This is merely a technical fault though. I will admit I am used to puzzle games with cues as to things you can touch or move and you don't get any of that with this game, which is totally fine, but perhaps next game let users decide a difficulty. One where you get cues or sparkles for things you can interact with. You don't need to give away how the object should move or what to do, but just that it has the potential to be interacted with either at that moment or at a later time. SPOILER ALERT FOLLOWS:::::::: example - the picture above the fireplace that requires a corner of the frame to be moved......i was touching and moving every single corner in every single direction and nothing happens. I knew one of those had to move, but I HAD to zoom in on the one that moves.....very deceiving! But I wanted to make sure this was clear to the developers because telling them the "controls are wonky sometimes" isn't helping to fix these issues. Thanks for an amazing game though! Still glad I bought it!!

content: Very similar to all the games in "The Room" trilogy; which is the exact type of game I go for... challenging and intelligent. Superb!

Very well made game, challenging. I recommend
Brilliant puzzle game
I enjoyed the games the graphics were awesome
Awesome

replyContent: Dear Luke. Thanks for your comment! The average gameplay is about 8 hours. We know this isn't days or weeks of unlimited gameplay, but in this genre, it's just not possible to create never-ending 3D puzzle adventure. Good news - we are planning a sequel for the next year. We will be glad if you give it a shot, too.

content: It would be a 5 star app but the controls are so finicky and frustrating. Everything has to line up precisely or things won't move. Swipe is used to both rotate objects and move individual pieces of objects, so you'll be stuck for ages rotating an object instead of moving one component. Otherwise, the game is great
replyContent: Hi Charli. Thank you for your review, we really appreciate it. We are making the gameplay experience better after each update, but we take your criticism seriously and hopefully, we can challenge your rating with the sequel :-) Is there anything you'd like to add? Get in touch with us via davinci@bluebraingames.com. Thanks!

content: Amazing as asual. This game is wonderfully involved, taking hidden object to a whole new interactive level. Beautiful graphics, absolutely love this game. Also try the Room games 1 to 3, incredible! Can't wait for more!

Very difficult interact with objects in the game, making game play very difficult. Good puzzles and concept. Never used the help button so much before, but was not due to diffuliculty. It was because I was not sure how to interact with many things due to difficulty of doing so. Was not worth the $5 charge, considering how much more you get for less money with The Room games.

content: Loved the room so I'm loving this. Great puzzels. Well done guys. Hope to see more of this in the near future.
Brilliant......hope you make another one
I loved this game.  Graphics and puzzle complexity were excellent!
If you've liked The Room series of games, you'll enjoy this one.
Amazing game for those who love challenge, excellent graphics and gameplay...well done!! Give us more, please!
Incredible graphics for a phone game. Addictive game.
It is a very good game, however, I felt there is no ending after I finished the game
Loved it!
A bit overpriced but a great game very similar to the room series
Reminds me of "The Room" trilogy! Great puzzle game!

The very best of games. I simply loved the graphics, controls and especially appreciated that the hints did not TELL you how to accomplish a task, but only gave a clue of what to look for! (You still had to solve the puzzle yourself) Like "The Room", it is my hope that these developers continue to make more games like these with new story lines without changing the way the player interacts with the screen. Thank you Blue Brain
Wonderfully executed homage to Leonardo!  The puzzles are sheer genius, and tricky.  And enjoyable escape to a bygone era.
Loved it.
It was great.  Loved it.  Just need to make more like it and quickly.
Just like The Room 1-3! So awesome!
Awesome game, maybe even better than The Room 3
Absolutely loved this game. Reminiscent of The Room games, but with a more obvious plot.
Love the game. Great puzzles. Only wish it offered cloud save as I got a new phone and now I have to start over.

Amazing game in the style of The Room series.  Fantastic sound, 3D graphics with manipulable objects and, and wonderfully immersive atmosphere.  The mechanical puzzles are challenging but definitely solvable.
If you like the Room series then you will like this too.  It has a good balance of difficulty and fun,  I liked it.

An absolutely fantastic puzzle game, but a bug has developed on my ASUS ZenPad 10.1. On Chapter 5: The Crypt.. I managed to get the fire lit in order to operate the pulleys for the cages on the table, however, no matter where I am in the room if I face the fire the whole graphics start to flicker, only when I face away from the fire the graphics are ok. I managed to get the 3rd pulley working to reveal a model temple in the center of the table but its impossible to solve the puzzles on one side of the temple when facing the fires direction. The flickering is so bad I cannot actually see one side of the temple and therefore cannot complete the puzzles. Is there a bug fix or should I get a new tablet?
Well worth what I payed
Got to the Golden globe and I could go no far, the occulus did not display the rolls.
replyContent: We believe you may have been using the oculi in a wrong way - you actually have two oculis on your glove. The first one takes you through time and the second one reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down - just tap and hold your finger on the oculi button and swipe.

content: Galaxy 7 screen was probably too small. Several points where a pixel mattered too much. I still enjoyed it and look forward to more.
You will ‚ô° it if you ‚ô°ed the Room series. Though it may not be connected, but it reminds me of the Room series at every step. A really nice game with good audio visuals.
Superb
Great game very entertaining!
Best game I've played this year so far..

I really loved the graphics, story, and puzzles. I really love these realistic games n Da vinci. The only downfall was you never find Da Vinci and it feels like there's no real conclusion. But well done for a first for Blue Brain.
Whilst waiting for the next 'The Room' game I stumbled upon this. It's fantastic, genuinely enjoying it and it could in fact be better than the room in some respects...  Great Work!!!
Keeps you guessing and thinking love it... solving some of the puzzle is intense which keeps you hooked...

terrific game.  tons of puzzles.  one problem i had in running the game on my Asus Chromebook Flip was that in some puzzles the Occuli viewer thingy woudnt engage on some of the scenes where you had to trace a pattern.  This was obviously a problem and i had to then rely on a cheat to advance the game.
Loved it!
Must say that I reserve giving 5 stars to games like this.  Graphics are fantastic, puzzles are great.  Keep making them this challenging and beautiful, and I will keep purchasing!
Beautifully done, gorgeous graphics, intuitive interface. Well done!
Great game
A little fiddly and the clues aren't always helpful but I really enjoyed this.
Great and like the developer from the room

This is a rare gem of a game following in the footsteps of the room. Having just finished the game, I can say that the quality is just as high, and the length is about that of the room 3. The controls can be a bit wonky on a few puzzles, but overall didn't get in the way of my enjoyment. The difficulty seems quite a bit higher, but for me that is a good thing. I hope to see more from this publisher.
Good mix of easy and hard puzzels.  I had the most trouble with navigating for some reason. Throughly enjoying it!  Looking forward to more.
If you like The Room you will love this. Incredible.

I rarely purchase games, but I was really happy to buy this one. By far the best mobile game I've played to date! The graphics were very smooth and beautifuly done. An excellent puzzle game and well plaued story.

If comparison to the room is to be made then highest praise is to be had. Could it be superior ? In some part yes. So to improve on something that's at the top of it's game excuse the pun is exceptional.
Fantastic!! Well worth the time and effort.
To good. No complaints. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
If you love the room, you must love this
Great game not to easy, some head scratchers for sure... loved it

I'm writing this not having finished the game, so my opinion may change.  That said, this reminds me of The Room games in all the best ways, but there are two viewing devices and so far not enough clues to justify making them different.  Usually, neither one is needed, which is why I feel like two is unnecessary complication.
Great game loved it not long enough when is the next one can't wait well done

This is just a fantastic game, love the design, the puzzles and controls. So similar to Room 1, 2 & 3! You want it to never end. Can be dark sometimes but obviously it is not made to be played on a bright sunny day, changing the brightness of your screen does help too!! Thank you so much for developing such good entertainment! Please made more of these
Excellent, enjoyed the game and the concept. On a par with the room series. Look forward to the next one. Soon please!
Great puzzles. Some are a bit vague. Controls bit finicky.
More fun please

Completed within a few days... glitched a few times and had to 're start, found it quite dark and unable to see parts even with my brightness on full. The game just ended and had no ending to the story (the letters the whole way through and none at the end closing the story)
replyContent: Thanks for your review, Jade. At the moment, we don't know about any bug in the game, but we'll be glad if you get in touch with us via davinci@bluebraingames.com ‚Äì we'll be happy to help. The whole story will be revealed in the sequel, which is set for the release next year :) Thanks for playing, we appreciate it.

content: I need lots more of this game! Please make more!

This had potential to be really great if it weren't for the overly dark active areas (I had to use hints way too many times because I couldn't see anything and that really took away a lot of the enjoyment) and hit or miss control issues, especially the castle arms (so far) I only got past it by shear luck. Love the 3D games though so I hope you make more and keep working on getting rid of glitches.  PS I wanted to come back and note that when I first submitted my review it was incorrectly showing that I had given it 5 stars, had to edit, and for that gave one less star than before. Makes me wonder how accurate the ratings that got my attention in the first place truely are. Hmmmm...

content: Brilliant game. I need another divinci chapter !
Fantastic graphics and great game play. Just the right difficult level, you have to think but not overly hard. Great entertainment! Recommended!
Please, please, PLEASE give us a sequel! This game is in my top 4. The number will increase if you give us more. Great job guys!

Reminds me of many of the puzzle games out there. This was longer and a bit more intuitive than most. Graphics were excellent, although I had the same trouble as others with the darkness. The game was best played in a dark room. The in envious to discover along the way was a fun addition. Well worth the money; I'm looking forward to more!
Good game

Brilliant. Only thing I would say is I do wish some of the puzzles could be skipped. I did finish the game though but some of the puzzles were really really hard, for me anyway. I did get there but I almost gave up.
Excellent. Great story and gameplay. Absolutely love it. Great work guys!
I only wish it was longer
Super game, waiting for the second issue.

Similar to The Room but with less imagination in the puzzles. Some scenes are so dark that it's hard to see what is going on. Crashed my tablet multiple times (hard crash - screen breaks up, junk on audio, can only fix by holding the power button down).
replyContent: Hi there. Thanks for your suggestions, we also appreciate the criticism. We're making the gameplay experience better after each update ‚Äì if you have a more detailed examples for us, we'll be happy to hear about it via davinci@bluebraingames.com. content: Hints are tiny on my S6 which makes them hard to read. Beautifully rendered graphics. Really enjoyed this. Hope there's another...
One of a Kind Gameplay.  Can't find too many like it!!! Please keep developing MORE!!!

Controls were a bit clunky. When i was working a puzzle the whole screen would move making it difficult to work. There needs to be some sort of screen lock when working certain puzzles. Some of the puzzles were all over the place. Didnt have a smooth flow. You would be working on a puzzle then have to side track to another room with no clues to lead you in the direction unless you use the hint. All and all it was an okay game. Concept stolen straight from The Room, but since ive finished all 3 of the room it was nice to have a game similar

content: Love it this is the kind of games that I play would love to design one but please whoever did this please bring another on I love it thank you
Awesome. I loved it. Very challenging and long!

This game was wonderful. The gameplay is smooth and satisfying. The graphics were beautiful. The puzzles were just the right level of difficulty. The only thing I would say is that for someone who doesn't like to 'cheat' and look at the hints they are very tempting and so I inadvertently looked at them a fair amount. Perhaps there should be more time between hints being generated. A very small criticism though for a brilliant game.
The only issue I had was trying to read the hints text. On Samsung Galaxy Note 8 screen, the text was very small. Also, the game did not support the S Pen.

Great job devs.  I enjoy room style puzzles and this game is by far the best one that I have come across.  Well worth the price.  If you enjoy these types of games I fully recommend getting this game.
I love this game.  I played all the "Room" games and was so happy when I found this one.  Looking forward to more like this one from you all.  Thanks.

FINALLY!!!! I FOUND IT!!!  If you have played The Room 1-3, then you will be so involved and fall in love with this game. I  would bet almost anything that the people that made The Room, had some kind of involvement with the development of this game. So many similarities from the controls, design and atmosphere and even with the soundtrack. Still, love this game and it was absolutely worth the monies!! If you love puzzle games, then you will love this one!
Different approach to The Room...loving it
Mean game waiting for more can't wait
Love
one of the best games i ever played.
Not bad but I liked "the room" much more. This game isn't worth the money when compared to "the room"
replyContent: Dear Josh, thanks for the review! We appreciate the criticism - and we'll be happy to hear more from you at davinci@bluebraingames.com. Thank you for getting in touch.

content: I love everything about this game. The graphics are sooo beautiful, the story line is extremely engaging and the puzzles are real brain teasers. Good long gameplay too - I don't want it to end!
Gr8 game I would recommend it 100%
Superb. Nicely balanced, amazing graphs and sound. Well done.
I am a fan of mechanical puzzles and this game does not disappoint. The puzzles are amazingly challenging. Hope to see more. Great job to the developers.
Alot like the game the room, very good
Great.

Yes yes yes....very similar to the room saga, but absolutely amazing, beautiful and uniquely captivating in its own right.  This/these type of game(s) are undoubtedly the best that any smart device has to offer.

Wow. Great game. Very challenging and frustrating at times. Puzzles are very similar to the ,"Room," game style.    A bit dark and hard to see but that is part of this games style. Take your time and enjoy it.  Looking forward to your next game.

Just love these high quality puzzle games. I imagine it's no secret to anyone that the room was in mind when this game was created, but with the bar set so high and for these guys to pull it off with verve is to me quite an accomplishment. Well done and l will always part with my money for the good stuff like this.
Excellent!  Some good challenges that make you think about it rather than easily plowing thru it.  Like others I had the same control issues at times, but nothing terrible. More please.
Beautiful! Really enjoying playing this game.
As a HUGE fan of The Room series, this game is brilliant!
I love this game. It makes you think, but isn't to overly hard.
Wow !
Awesome game. Just wish my phone battery would last longer. Couldn't tell you how many times it went flat cause I played so long. Lol

This game strongly reminded me of the late 90s PC game Myst. I loved that game, with all its logic puzzles and how much reasoning skill it required. This game was just as amazing if not better! I can't wait to see what they come out with next!
Wow
Beautiful puzzle box/room game. Similar to The Room games. Very good quality.
I love the mystery and challenge. My only criticism is that I am at the "Globe" and it seems to be stuck. I have completed the desk search and the hints stop. Any help?
Should have been longer. But great game.
Fantastic
Game is really good. Perfect for my subway commute.

There were a few minor graphic bugs and some spots required a difficult amount of precision to manage with a small touch screen. The game would be more immersive if those were fixed. Otherwise, the gameplay and story is good and the graphics are commendable. Some of the puzzles were a bit simple, but others were rather challenging, so it balanced out well. I look forward to replaying this game and hope for more like this from the devs.

I loved it but kind of stumped by the ending.....it kind of...didnt...im hoping that is because there will be more chapters to come? I hope so anyway.. As for game itself...cant flaw it really except, as others have said, a bit dark and difficult to see things sometimes, especially if there's a small hidden compartment latch or something. I would say definitely inspired by 'the room' series, equally as brilliant and different enough to give it's own name a nod. Da Vinci is such a great person to base a puzzle game off...i did need some hints (though I blame that on just having had surgery and on a lot of morphine and things not because of my lacking genius lol üòâ) the puzzles were bizarre enough to imagine Da Vinci would have been behind them yet not so bizarre you get frustrated and lose interest. Definitely helped that is already played the room series simply due to the style of gaming being so different to anything else...i do agree this game would look amazing on VR. If you enjoyed the room series, you'll love this one. Hope more follow!
Excellent. A challenging game with fabulous graphics and art work. Waiting for the sequel.
Great game. Ingenious.  If you love The Room series. You will love this game
Challenging but not too hard.  It reminds me of the room trilogy guide a bit.  The graphics are awesome and the puzzles even more so! 5*
Love it. Makes you think
If you liked the room you`ll like this
This is very similar to the room but some of the puzzles are not intuitive. Sometimes you will know what you need to do,  but will be unable to do it without help.
replyContent: Dear Adam. Thanks for your feedback, we appreciate the criticism as well. We are optimizing the game after each update &¬†we'll be releasing a sequel to this story next year. We hope you will give it a try and let us know if we've improved. Thanks!

content: Brilliant! Some puzzles are a bit harder, but enjoyable nonetheless.
Keeps your mind working love it !!!
I was lost after finishing The Room series.. until I discovered this little bad boy! Well worth the dollar spent! Encore!!!!
Excellent game, reminiscent of The Room game series.
Great

Amazing! Didn't think if find a game as well made as The Room series but this is it. Well done.

Awesome
So glad I found this game, the quality is top notch and very similar to The Room games. Thanks for a great game devs.
Excellent game, very thought provoking. brill

A blatant knock-off of The Room series, but that said it's an undeniably brilliant knock-off with fantastic puzzles and graphics. This is a BIG game, don't expect to fly through it in an hour, it's well worth the small fee. As a big fan of The Rooms eagerly awaiting the 4th installment, I highly recommend this game.

It's a good game, with very nice graphics. The "challenge" is not getting frustrated by the repetitive sequences. Move thing-a-ma-bob in room one, which reveals an odd part. Take part to room two. Insert part in slot X, which reveals new part/puzzle/clue. Return to room one. Rinse. Repeat.
replyContent: Hi John. Thanks for your comment, we appreciate the criticism as well. However, a gameplay like this is sort of expected, isn't it? It's a 3D puzzle adventure, after all. Anyway, thanks for playing :-)

content: Just perfect !
Very fun game. Almost a carbon copy of the "The Room" series, but with a different eeriness about it. Highly recommend

Basically, If you're a fan of 'The Room' series, you'll like this. Almost identical gameplay, puzzles, graphics and controls. 4 Stars because they could have been a bit inventive, not just copied, but it's well executed.
Loved it. Which it could last longer or have a sequel of sorts some how
Awesome game, reminds me of myst but its way to short. Make a sequel and make it longer. Maybe even make a series.

Graphically similar to the room, similarly ends there! Very confusing, no logic involved for most of the game. Contols were HORRIBLE! I spent most of my time trying to get the finicky control to obey! Was more like a chore than a game, glad it's over! Although, I DID play it all the way to the end...
replyContent: Hi Kat. Thanks for your comment, we also appreciate the criticism. On the other hand, we are a bit frustrated by your comment - was it really that horrible? We've almost never received a feedback like yours. Thanks for playing anyway, we hope we can do better for the sequel, which is set to be released next year.

content: Fun but thought provoking.

For a point and click, this game was just hard enough to keep you going but not frustrated. What I appreciated was the fact you could get as many hints as you wanted but couldn't skip puzzles. This alone was better than most. The scenes and graphics were great. Sure some of the actions weren't always smooth but it gave me many hours of game play.   The next iteration will certainly be one to look forward to playing.
Great game. Much like the room series. Hope they release another game soon.
Great game. Very cool puzzles
Few glitches still but good game
Only just started the game but what I've seen atm it's an awesome game like the room games
Overall really good game. Only complaint would be that controls we're a bit touchy at times like controlling pipes or sliders up/down vs. left,/right.

Clearly inspired by The Room.  The storyline isn't as deep, but as a first offering, it's extremely impressive. Composing puzzles isn't easy and most of these were pretty good. There were a few cases where I was frustrated by the lack of freedom of movement or examination. This was not quite on the same level as The Room but I enjoyed it, and will be interested in any future games from this developer, whether it continues the da Vinci theme or not.
Awesome! I'm ready for a sequel!
Similar style to "The Room", yes, absolutely...truly wonderful game that was much longer than I expected. Fabulous!!!

I can't get enough of these types of games. I loved the Room series and was happy to find something similar! I need more! üòä Also, the brightness wasn't an issue on my phone....so everyone who complained about brightness, might be a phone issue not a game issue. Not their fault your phone sucks.. Can't wait for another!!!

Best game ever! I loved every second! The graphics were amazing.  Best game I have ever played, and I am addicted  to  adventure  escape  games. I loved the story and all of the wonderfully thought out puzzles. Can't wait for the sequel.  I would love to be a beta tester üòâ .
Awesome and amazing
Excellent love the game, great graphics and game play, and you really feel great when you solve a puzzle and makes you want to keep going
Awesome game! Very well done, can't wait for more.
Great game so far
Awesome!

Excellent. Enjoyed every minute of it. I dont think it was too dark at all. Maybe some people have older phones. I admit to getting only two hints and i could have kicked myself at needing those as id spotted harder bits. Definitely doable with no hints but maybe only for those who are veterans at puzzle games and escape rooms.  Would recommend to anyone. I love the graphics amd wouldnt they be exceptional in VR. Its crying out for it. Doesnt need nit picking. It is what it is, and what it is, is a well balanced adventure, not too easy, but not too hard. With the hints my total play time was about an hour and a half over a few days. Not bad for a few bob.  Looking forward to more of the same.  Ian. Accrington
The Room series games are by far my favorite app games, and now House of Da Vinci is right there as well. Hope to see more games like these.
Amazing. Style is like The Room but the story is 100% different and I loved it.

Pros - fantastic graphics. Lots of detail.  Some puzzles well thought out and make sense (and some just don't) Cons - can be a bit dark and hard to notice things even at Max brightness.  Some puzzles make no sense, just a puzzle for the sake of a puzzle. You will need hints. Can get a little boring and repetitive (tower level, if I have to make the stairs move one more time...) Overall a good game but I think the reason for strong reviews are the graphics.
replyContent: Thanks for your comment, we really appreciate it. The House of Da Vinci is our fist game in this genre and we are all thrilled by the response we are getting every day. Sure, not all comments and reviews are 100% positive, but we're making a list of possible enhancements for the sequel, which is planned for the next year. Thanks for your feedback!

content: Great game for those who loves the series Room puzzle! Won't be disappointed.
Excellent game.

Being a big fan of The Room trilogy, this game is right in my wheelhouse. It was a wonderful find after so many months of  playing nothing worth a hoot from the play store. I had some fine tuning issues with the controls, but can't say the problem wasn't with my phone. I highly recommend this for your next download!
Worth the money
Absolute awesomeness!
AMAZING üòä like everyone else this game is akin to the room series but the quality and game play is well worth the money. More please

I will have to give this one a 3. Although initially I thought it's going to be a Room clone and was extremely happy about it, I realized the similarities stop at controls and visuals. Unfortunately the puzzles are poorer than the Room puzzles and pretty similar to what you find in Big Fish games. Almost expected a hidden object scene here and there. I hated the puzzles where you have to spin some piece ten dozen times instead of using wits to figure it out. The Europe conquest and spinning numbers puzzles are just trite nicely dressed in stunning visuals. Sorry guys, won't buy the next one.
Awesome!!!!  Please make more!!
Very well done game. Hope the developer makes many more like it.
Similar to the room, great game
Similar to The Room 1-3‚ù§
Well worth the money.  It such a clever game and really tests your skills.  I would recommend it to anyone.

I finally found a game resembling The Room. If you're into that kind of puzzling games then definitely buy it. I haven't noticed any major control problems so don't be intimidated by some comments down below. I almost never rate the games I play but this one deserved a whole comment.
Fun game, but a little frustrating at times. I knew what to do a lot of times, but couldn't figure out how to do it. Worth the play.

After playing The Room I thought I'd never find a game that came close. Except I have and this is it! The controls can be a little frustrating, zooming in on sections when you're trying to look at others etc. It's still an incredible game with some real noodle scratcher puzzles.
The movement controls are a little difficult to move in on some spots, but okay otherwise.
Awesome
I hate this game and want my money back. I can't see anything it's so dark. Sure feel like I wasted my money
replyContent: Hi Cassandra. If this game isn't what you expected, you can ask for a refund up to 48 hours after the purchase. If you believe that the darkness is a bug, please get in touch with us via davinci@bluebraingames.com. Thanks!

content: If you liked the room. You'll like this.

I love these type of games,need more!
Enjoyed it very much
Great game, in line with the room series, with the price

The game is great... all the way till you get to a match the colored gems on a circle puzzle. Then if you're even partially color blind (as I am)...  You're done.  2 of the colors look exactly the same to me.
replyContent: Dear Steven. We're sorry you're having problems because of your partial color blindness. The game indeed isn't optimized for such condition. I am only a short way into the game, so my final review will depend on the overall story arc and resolution. But so far the graphics are great, the puzzles are at a good challenge level for me, and I am engaged by the story.  In comparison to The Room, the controls are a bit clunkier (moving objects doesnt feel quite natural) and it has less of that creepy, supernatural feel I liked in The Room, but on the other hand the story seems to be more robust and there are actual rules/explanations for how the eyepieces work.  A really satisfying ending will likely bump this game up to 5 stars for me, definitely a contender at or above The Room and possibly Myst.  Time will tell!  Update after completing the game:  the puzzles could be extremely difficult at times, particularly the ones that require you to discover several random-seeming pieces of information and putting them together in the correct sequence.  Once I started taking copious notes and screenshots like I did in Myst, I was able to get through things much more easily, and I finished the game in under 5 hours.  The ending was fine, but I was hoping for something more satisfying.  Story was at a similar level to The Room, but manipulating objects was considerably less smooth, so I give this 4 stars.

Ok. So this is a must play. Great graphics and good puzzle to solve. However even if some people are saying that this is better than the "The Room" I will not agree. Graphically, this is one of the most stunning games I have played. I mostly loved it, but many of the puzzles are eye wateringly difficult. I'm a very experienced adventure/ hidden object game player and have played the three Room games, and the difficulty of da Vinci was extreme in places. I still have no clue how the solution to the rotating numbers puzzle was shown on the model aeroplane and the vial. I had to use all the clues in most scenarios and look up walkthroughs on the internet frequently, making the game very frustrating at times and, having to do this was unacceptable. Manipulating levers and switches also proved difficult as well, and all in all, I wouldn't pay for a sequel just to spend a lot if time scratching my head in despair.

replyContent: Please check the sound settings and volume settings within your phone. Some apps ignore these settings and still play sound even if it's turned off, that's why you might think your sound is on even if it isn't. There isn't any known issue with sound on any device :-) Thanks!

I'm a huge fan of The Room series, and have finished all those games. This has a similar vibe, but the controls are incredibly frustrating. The problem is that the viewpoint shifts from centered on the player to centered on an object (while in The Room it's always centered on the object). This seems like a minor thing, but has me moving the camera in the wrong direction CONSTANTLY, and it's maddening. A lot of the places I get stuck involve manipulating things that are supposed to "look slightly off", but actually don't, so the gameplay becomes an exercise in trying to move everything in the scene. I would probably be more forgiving if the controls weren't frustrating me so much.

replyContent: Hi Brian. We believe you may have been using the oculi in a wrong way - you actually have two oculis on your glove. Oculi Infinitum takes you through time and Oculi Tempus reveals hidden mechanisms, locks etc. You can choose between the two oculis by sliding your finger up and down - just tap and hold your finger on the oculi button and swipe.

This is an excellent game in a similar vein to The Room series but set in a fantasy-medieval world.  One nice touch is that as you work your way around you can collect designs for some of Leonardo's real inventions and as you do each of these becomes available as a playable working model in the 'Achievements' room (see video).  I think my favourite puzzle was near the end where you have to find the right settings on a complex machine, and it seems as though you don't have enough information but then suddenly it all drops into place.  There's a good hint system, which is often useful if you simply don't know which object you should have examined more on a large level, but sometimes it's a bit to keen to pop up and I think a longer timeout before it offered a hint would have been good. I did try turning it off but found that more frustrating. (However I still think Lumino City has the best hint system).  A sequel is already promised, so let's hope it doesn't take them too many years.

It's fantastic,  As a major fan of The Room games, I give this my full seal of approval.  An original story, excellent puzzles, great music, beautifully and lovingly detailed reconstructions of daVinci's home and inventions. And don't give me any nonsense that it's a "ripoff" of The Room. Please. How many first person shooter games are there out there? Aren't they all basically the same idea? Might as well call The Room a ripoff of Myst, the 90's PC game that pioneered the concept of spooky, atmospheric puzzle adventure games with gorgeously rendered graphics. This game is a labor of love and it shows. Buy it! PLAY IT!

Fantastic.  Similar to "The Room" series but has it's own flavor and enticements.   The graphics are excellent and enhance game play immensely.   The background music and theme are not at all intrusive but help build suspense.   Other sound effects are quite realistic.  The controls are generally excellent but I found them to be a bit clumsy in places.   The puzzles were first rate with several being real mind benders.  I look forward to a sequel and other future titles from these artists.
Kind of hard to play on my phone. But loving it so far!
If you love puzzle games like The Room and Myst, you will love this game no problem. Had a blast playing this.

Such wonderfully thought out and beautiful puzzles. It's almost a shame to rush through the solutions :-) That is, until you inevitably get stuck once in a while, ofcourse....  Theme, art & gameplay all work together and the whole package sings to me. I found my name (Vadjong) as a kickstarter! Look me up in the library. There will be a pressing achievement really close by, wink, wink!
Controls can be a bit wonky at times, but other than that, it's great!
